description: Israel has received the coffin of a missing hostage handed over to the Red Cross from Hamas, Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu's office said Friday.
title: Hamas hands over missing body of hostage, Israel says

description: Roderick Sutherland has been found guilty of manslaughter in connection with the 2020 murder of Megan Gallagher.
title: Sask. jury finds Roderick Sutherland guilty of manslaughter in death of Megan Gallagher

description: The Conservative Party of Canada is calling on the federal government to publicly release its contracts with Stellantis following the company’s announcement Tuesday that it will move production of its Jeep Compass model from Brampton, Ont., to Illinois.
title: Poilievre demands federal government release its contracts with Stellantis

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney made a stop in Breslau on Friday to tap a keg during the last weekend of Kitchener-Waterloo Oktoberfest events.
title: Prime Minister Mark Carney takes in K-W Oktoberfest

description: Two people who live near the home of Jack and Lilly Sullivan told police they heard a vehicle coming and going in the middle of the night, just hours before the Nova Scotia children were reported missing, court documents show.
title: Witnesses describe hearing vehicle the night before N.S. children reported missing

description: RCMP are launching billboard messaging for missing 11-year-old Kai Pavlovic, who police have been searching for since Sept. 26.
title: RCMP launch province-wide billboard campaign to find missing 11-year-old Kai Pavlovic

description: The association representing 51,000 Alberta teachers who have been off the job since Oct. 6 says employers asked them to return to classrooms voluntarily and attend talks where class-size caps and pupil-teacher ratios were off the table.
title: Striking Alberta teachers refuse to engage in talks that exclude pupil-teacher ratio

description: Prime Minister Mark Carney will travel to Malaysia, Singapore and South Korea over nine days at the end of the month to attend two multinational summits.
title: Carney heading to Asia for 9-day trip to work on trade, defence partnerships
Amid scandal, Prince Andrew says he will no longer use titles or honours
Prince Andrew gives up royal titles, honours

description: The men, David Anthony Di Rienzo, Tenaj Johnson, Carson Vaudry, Mason Pereira-Walker, Paul Letourneau and Steven Pettruzziello pleaded guilty to conspiracy and fraud charges. In an agreed statement of facts filed in court, they acknowledged making scam calls to U.S. seniors between 2019 and 2021.
title: 6 Montrealers plead guilty to participating in grandparent scam targeting U.S. seniors

description: The men, David Anthony Di Rienzo, Tenaj Johnson, Carson Vaudry, Mason Pereira-Walker and Paul Letourneau and Steven Pettruzziello pleaded guilty to conspiracy and fraud charges. In an agreed statement of facts filed in court, they acknowledged making scam calls to U.S. seniors between 2019 and 2021.
title: Six Montrealers plead guilty to participating in grandparent scam targeting U.S. seniors

description: Toronto Pearson Airport reported Friday that an outage at its inspection kiosks  had held up passengers in two terminals, the latest issue to hit aging IT infrastructure at the Canada Border Services Agency.
title: Border kiosk outages ‘not acceptable,’ CBSA president says

description: The federal government is moving forward with existing plans to beef up border security, including a campaign promise to hire 1,000 new personnel.
title: Federal government to push ahead with plan to hire 1,000 border workers
U.S. military has detained survivors from a deadly boat strike, sources tell Reuters

description: The U.S. has succeeded in blocking a global fee on shipping emissions as an international maritime meeting adjourned Friday without adopting regulations.
title: International deal to cut shipping emissions falters under U.S. pressure

description: The union representing 34,000 striking public sector workers says it will enter mediation over a labour dispute that has threatened the delivery of services in the province.
title: Striking B.C. public service workers agree to mediation after 7 weeks on pickets

description: Adelita Grijalva from Arizona won a special congressional election more than three weeks ago, but has yet to take the oath of office. Democrats say the Republican House Speaker is trying to delay this, because it could lead to an uncomfortable request for the Trump administration.
title: Who is Adelita Grijalva, and what does she have to do with the Epstein files?

description: The trial of a Toronto-area man charged with 14 murders — amid allegations he sold a toxic substance to buyers at risk of suicide — has been delayed until the spring, CBC News has learned.
title: Murder trial for alleged poison seller Kenneth Law delayed until spring 2026

description: A Wet'suwet'en leader and two other pipeline opponents have been given suspended jail sentences and community service for breaking an injunction against blocking work on the Coastal GasLink pipeline.
title: Trio given suspended jail sentences, community service following Wet'suwet'en blockade

description: A Wet’suwet’en leader convicted after blocking work on the Coastal GasLink pipeline addressed a B.C. Supreme Court at the end of sentencing arguments on Thursday, telling the judge her land "has never been ceded or surrendered."
title: 'We are the land,' Sleydo' tells B.C. court at Wet'suwet'wen blockade sentencing

description: Sporting a Blue Jays jersey and always tapping out a tune on his drum set, ‘Rockin' Rick’ has been a fixture outside Rogers Centre since he first started busking in 1989. He's now retiring from busking after the season ends.
title: Blue Jays drummer 'Rockin' Rick' hanging up his sticks, retiring from busking
Lead found in popular protein powders and shakes by Consumer Reports testing
How Tomahawk missiles could change the war between Russia and Ukraine
Trump shows hesitance to send Kyiv Tomahawk missiles in talks with Zelenskyy
Trump's next peace priority is Ukraine-Russia. Here's why it will be harder than Gaza

description: A Winnipeg sepsis survivor says he wants to see Manitoba follow Nova Scotia's lead and change how it treats the condition that almost killed him nine years ago.
title: Nova Scotia has changed the way it treats sepsis. This man who almost died says Manitoba should, too

description: Former Gov. Andrew Cuomo entered Thursday evening's first New York mayoral debate trying to blunt Democratic front-runner Zohran Mamdani's momentum. Instead he spent much of the contentious faceoff on defence, batting away criticisms over his long tenure in office from Mamdani and Republican Curtis Sliwa.
title: Key takeaways from Mamdani-Cuomo faceoff in heated NYC mayoral debate
Sudden closing of high-profile home renovation company leaves customers with few places to turn

description: Tax deductible donations made by Canadians to groups that financially support West Bank settlements that are illegal under international law are continuing in the face of escalating attacks on Palestinian civilians, an investigation by CBC's the fifth estate has found.
title: Canadian charities complicit in helping fund Israeli settlement movement in West Bank, critics say

description: For decades, Taiwan‘s government, tech sector and education system have been working together to become the world leader in making microchips. But the island remains under threat from China, and Taiwanese are asking how their global prominence can help.
title: For most of the world, Taiwan doesn’t officially exist. Its microchips make it hard to ignore

description: The Jennifer Lopez-starring, Tonatiuh-led Kiss of the Spider Woman is an interesting drama. But it's not your entry-level musical.
title: Jennifer Lopez's Kiss of the Spider Woman is too musical for its own good

description: A charity for adults with developmental disabilities has relocated some residents due to a labour dispute with support workers. Concerned family members say they didn’t consent.
title: Ontario charity relocated residents with autism without consent, their families say

description: The United Nations humanitarian relief chief is urging Israel to open up all entrances to Gaza to allow a surge of aid into the territory. Tom Fletcher, UN Under-Secretary-General for Humanitarian Affairs and Emergency Relief spoke to CBC News from El-Arish, Egypt after visiting the Rafah Crossing between Egypt and Gaza.
title: Thousands of aid vehicles must reach Gaza weekly to ease crisis, UN's humanitarian relief chief says
